docs.title: 你与天空之间，只差一个念头的距离
docs.text: 不是优化，是从零构建——基于实时操作系统从零打造，精心调校的信号链路确保锐利响应与丝滑手感并存，渐进式安全机制让每一次降落都在掌控之中。从摇杆到桨叶，每一个操控意图都被即时、精准地转化为飞行

docs.title: 核心优势
docs.text:
• 即时响应

    并行架构，独立任务——从指尖到桨叶，微秒级传达，一气呵成

  • 从零构建

    每一行代码，都为飞行而生——没有移植，没有妥协，只有纯粹

  • 渐进守护

    多级安全机制，从信号恢复到安全着陆，每一级都有预案

  • 精调滤波

    精心调校的信号处理链路，让锐利响应与丝滑手感不再是取舍题

docs.title: 专业能力
docs.text:
• 物理建模

    基于刚体动力学，飞行器的每一个响应都符合它本该有的样子

  • 一键校准

    传感器自校准，静置片刻即可完成——复杂的事情，交给固件来做

  • 直观配置

    简洁的界面，清晰的逻辑——看一眼就懂，上手即会

  • 无损记录

    全新研发的无损黑盒日志，你的每一个动作都被精准记录、完整还原

docs.title: atbetaflight
docs.text:
atbetaflight 是 Betaflight 的 AT32 移植版本，由 FlightNG 团队维护。

查看源代码

docs.title: 简介
docs.text: atbetaflight 在 Betaflight 的基础上添加了对 AT32 芯片的支持，适合熟悉 Betaflight 的用户无缝迁移。

docs.title: 特性
docs.text:
基于 Betaflight 4.3.1，添加了以下功能：

  • AT32F435/F437 芯片支持
  • BMI270 驱动优化
  • LSM6DSO 驱动优化
  • 添加 LSM6DSL/LSM6DS3TR-C/LSM6DS3 支持
  • 史密斯预测器

docs.title: 与 Fidelity X 的区别
docs.text: 项目 atbetaflight Fidelity X 基础 Betaflight 移植 全新开发 配置工具 Betaflight Configurator CLI 学习曲线 低（熟悉BF的用户） 中等 功能更新 跟随 Betaflight 独立开发

docs.title: 适用人群
docs.text:
• 熟悉 Betaflight 的用户
  • 希望使用图形化配置工具的用户
  • 需要 Betaflight 特定功能的用户

docs.title: atbetaflight 使用教程
docs.text: 本教程介绍如何使用 atbetaflight 固件。

docs.title: 准备工作
docs.text:
需要安装：

  • Artery DFU 驱动
  • Betaflight Configurator（特定版本）

下载 Artery DFU 驱动 下载 Betaflight Configurator

docs.title: 下载固件
docs.text: 从 GitHub Releases 下载最新固件。

docs.title: 固件对照表
docs.text:
根据飞控型号选择固件：

MCU 飞控 固件 AT32F435VMT7 EMSRPROTO2 / 重山1.2 betaflight-xxx-EMSRPROTO2 AT32F437VGT7 EMSRPROTO3 betaflight-xxx-EMSRPROTO3 AT32F435RGT7 NEUTRONRCF435SE betaflight-xxx-NEUTRONRCF435SE AT32F435CGU7 NEUTRONRCF435MINI betaflight-xxx-NEUTRONRCF435MINI

docs.title: 烧录固件
docs.text:
1. 按住飞控 BOOT 按钮，连接 USB
  2. 打开 Betaflight Configurator
  3. 点击 Firmware Flasher
  4. 点击 Load local firmware 选择固件
  5. 按照正常 F4 飞控方式刷写

docs.title: 注意事项
docs.text:
重要

  • DIY 空白 MCU 飞控需要先使用雅特力工具刷写用户系统数据（仅一次）
  • 成品飞控无需此步骤
  • 如果飞控不在 DFU 模式，请勿勾选"无重启序列"选项

docs.title: Fidelity X
docs.text:
Fidelity X 不只是一款飞控固件

它是对"飞行应该是什么感觉"这个问题的全新回答——不是优化，是从零构建。每一行代码都服务于同一个目标：让你与飞行器之间的连接，前所未有地紧密

docs.title: 为你的风格而生
docs.text:
三种速率曲线，可以混合使用：

  • Betaflight Rate — 熟悉的手感，无缝迁移
  • Actual Rate — 直观设置，所见即所得
  • FlightOne Rate — FalcoX 用户的自然选择

Yaw、Pitch、Roll 可以分别使用不同曲线。你的飞行风格，由你定义。

docs.title: 基础命令
docs.text: 命令 功能 help 显示所有命令 status 系统状态概览 version 固件版本信息 reboot 重启系统 bootloader 进入 DFU 模式

docs.text: 命令 功能 param list 列出所有参数 param get <名称> 获取参数值 param set <名称> <值> 设置参数 param save 保存到 Flash param load 从 Flash 加载 param reset 重置为默认值

docs.text: 命令 功能 failsafe status 显示安全系统状态 failsafe test rc 测试 RC 丢失响应 failsafe test arming 测试解锁条件 failsafe reset 重置安全系统状态

docs.title: 电机命令
docs.text:
警告

测试电机前请卸下螺旋桨！

命令 功能 motor test <电机号> <油门> 测试单个电机 motor stop 停止电机测试 motor info 显示电机配置

示例： 

motor test 1 0.1    # 电机1，10%油门
motor stop

docs.text: 参数 默认值 说明 PID_ROLL_P 45 Roll P增益 PID_ROLL_I 80 Roll I增益 PID_ROLL_D 35 Roll D增益 PID_PITCH_P 45 Pitch P增益 PID_PITCH_I 80 Pitch I增益 PID_PITCH_D 35 Pitch D增益 PID_YAW_P 45 Yaw P增益 PID_YAW_I 80 Yaw I增益

docs.title: 安全系统参数
docs.text: 参数 默认值 说明 FS_RC_LOSS_STAGE_1_TIME 150 RC丢失阶段1时间(ms) FS_BAT_WARN_V 14.4 电池警告电压 FS_BAT_CRIT_V 13.2 电池危险电压

docs.title: 功能特性
docs.text: 每一项功能，都经过精心打磨。 每一个细节，都服务于更好的飞行。

docs.title: 实时架构
docs.text:
不是优化，是重新设计。

传统固件在单一循环中依次处理任务，任何一个环节的延迟都会影响整体性能。Fidelity X 采用实时操作系统，让关键任务真正并行运行：

  • 陀螺仪采样独立于主循环
  • 姿态解算拥有专属优先级
  • 电机输出永远准时

结果：确定性的响应时间，无论系统负载如何。

docs.title: 滤波系统
docs.text: 信号处理，决定飞行品质。

docs.title: 陀螺仪滤波
docs.text:
消费级 MEMS 陀螺仪并不完美——电机振动、机架谐振、传感器噪声，都会污染原始数据。

我们的滤波系统精确识别这些干扰，保留真实的姿态变化。你感受到的，是纯净的飞行数据带来的精准响应。

docs.title: D 项滤波
docs.text:
PID 的微分项天生对噪声敏感。我们设计了专用的低相移滤波器，在抑制高频噪声的同时，将相位畸变降到最低。

效果：电机保持冷静，响应依然锐利。

docs.title: 安全系统
docs.text:
始终运行。无法关闭。

这不是一个可选功能——这是我们的设计哲学。

docs.title: 信号丢失保护
docs.text:
两阶段智能响应：

阶段 触发 响应 第一阶段 信号丢失 姿态稳定 第二阶段 持续丢失 受控停机

docs.title: 解锁检测
docs.text:
起飞前，系统自动验证：

  • 传感器工作正常
  • 油门处于最低位
  • 遥控信号有效
  • 系统状态健康

只有一切就绪，才允许解锁。

docs.title: 双环 PID
docs.text:
• 外环：角度控制，用于自稳模式
  • 内环：角速度控制，核心响应来源

docs.title: 速率曲线
docs.text:
三种风格，一种选择权——你的。

曲线 适合 Betaflight Rate 从 Betaflight 迁移的飞手 Actual Rate 喜欢直观设置的飞手 FlightOne Rate 从 FalcoX 迁移的飞手

每个轴可以独立选择曲线类型。混搭，由你。

docs.title: OSD
docs.text:
通过 MSP 协议驱动，兼容主流图传。屏幕上显示的，是你需要的信息：

电池电压　 飞行时间　 信号强度　 飞行模式

docs.title: Blackbox
docs.text:
飞行数据，完整保存。

采用基于 Gorilla 算法的时序压缩格式，在有限的 Flash 空间内记录更长时间的飞行数据。每一帧数据都无损保存，支持事后深度分析。

docs.title: 遥控协议
docs.text: 协议 频率 备注 CRSF 150-500Hz 推荐，最低延迟 SBUS 100Hz 广泛兼容

docs.title: 电机协议
docs.text:
双向 DShot600。

指令传输与转速反馈，都在微秒级完成。闭环设计让动态 RPM 滤波成为可能——精准追踪电机谐波，实时消除。

docs.text:

本指南介绍如何将 Fidelity X 固件烧录到飞控板上。

docs.title: 烧录方式
docs.text: 方式 适用场景 难度 USB DFU 日常更新 ⭐ 简单 Artery ISP 首次烧录/救砖 ⭐⭐ 中等 SWD 开发调试 ⭐⭐⭐ 高级

docs.title: USB DFU 模式（推荐）
docs.text: 这是最常用的固件烧录方式。

docs.title: 准备
docs.text:
1. 下载 Artery DFU 驱动
  2. 下载 Artery ISP Programmer
  3. 下载对应飞控的固件

docs.title: 1. 进入 DFU 模式
docs.text:
1. 断开飞控所有电源
  2. 按住 BOOT 按钮
  3. 连接 USB 线到电脑
  4. 松开 BOOT 按钮

docs.title: 2. 验证 DFU 模式
docs.text:
在 Windows 设备管理器中应该看到：

通用串行总线控制器
└── AT32 DFU Device

驱动问题

如果显示为"未知设备"，请安装 Artery DFU 驱动。

docs.title: 3. 烧录固件
docs.text:
1. 打开 Artery ISP Programmer
  2. 选择 USB 接口
  3. 点击 Connect 连接
  4. 在 Download 标签页加载 .hex 固件
  5. 点击 Download 开始烧录
  6. 等待烧录完成

docs.title: 4. 完成
docs.text: 断开 USB，重新连接，飞控将运行新固件。

docs.title: 使用 CLI 进入 DFU
docs.text:
如果飞控已运行 Fidelity X，可以通过命令进入 DFU 模式：

bootloader

飞控会重启并自动进入 DFU 模式。

docs.title: 首次烧录空白芯片
docs.text:
重要

全新的空白芯片首次烧录时，需要先写入用户系统数据（USD）。 成品飞控通常已预先写入，无需此步骤。

  1. 在 Artery ISP Programmer 中选择 "User System Data"
  2. 加载对应芯片的 USD 文件
  3. 点击 Download
  4. 然后再烧录固件

docs.title: SWD 调试器烧录
docs.text: 适用于开发调试，需要 SWD 调试器（如 J-Link、DAP-Link）。

docs.title: 接线
docs.text: 调试器 飞控 SWDIO SWDIO SWCLK SWCLK GND GND

docs.title: 固件选择参考
docs.text: 飞控板 固件名称 NeutronRC F435 SE fydelix-NeutronRCF435SE NeutronRC F435 MINI fydelix-NeutronRCF435MINI Hummingbird 200RS fydelix-Hummingbird200RS Hummingbird 255 V1 fydelix-Hummingbird255V1REVA StingerBee fydelix-StingerBee

docs.title: 连接串口
docs.text:
• 波特率：115200
  • 数据位：8
  • 停止位：1

docs.title: 检查启动
docs.text:
正常启动后会显示命令提示符：msh />

输入 status 查看系统状态。

docs.title: 故障排除
docs.text:
无法进入 DFU 模式
  • 确保 USB 线是数据线
  • 尝试不同的 USB 端口
  • 按住 BOOT 按钮后再连接 USB
烧录失败
  • 检查固件与飞控型号是否匹配
  • 尝试全片擦除后重新烧录
  • 检查 USB 连接是否稳定
烧录后无法启动
  • 确认固件型号正确
  • 尝试 _legacy 版本固件
  • 检查串口波特率设置

docs.title: 恢复出厂设置
docs.text:
param reset
param save

警告

这将清除所有自定义设置！

docs.title: 快速开始
docs.text: 本指南将帮助你快速上手 Fidelity X 固件。

docs.title: 硬件需求
docs.text:
• 支持的飞控板（查看列表）
  • USB 数据线
  • 电脑（Windows/macOS/Linux）

docs.title: 软件需求
docs.text:
软件 用途 获取方式 Artery DFU 驱动 固件烧录 雅特力官网 Chrome/Chromium 浏览器 连接配置器 需要支持 WebUSB/WebSerial

浏览器要求

需要使用支持 WebUSB/WebSerial 的浏览器，推荐使用 Chrome 或基于 Chromium 的浏览器（如 Edge、Brave 等）。

docs.title: 1. 下载固件
docs.text:
从 GitHub Releases 下载对应你飞控板的固件。

固件命名格式：fydelix-<飞控型号>-<版本>-<提交号>.hex

提示

不确定选哪个固件？查看 支持的硬件 找到你的飞控型号。

docs.title: 2. 烧录固件
docs.text:
详细的烧录步骤请参考 固件烧录指南。

简要步骤：

  1. 按住飞控 BOOT 按钮
  2. 连接 USB 线到电脑
  3. 松开 BOOT 按钮
  4. 在 Configurator 中选择本地固件文件
  5. 点击烧录按钮

docs.title: 3. 首次连接
docs.text:
烧录完成后，使用 Configurator 连接飞控：

  1. 点击右上角的 连接 按钮
  2. 在弹出菜单中选择 FlightNG FC

docs.title: 检查飞控朝向
docs.text:
首先确认飞控朝向是否正确：

  1. 观察 Configurator 中显示的飞机姿态
  2. 移动实际飞机，确认虚拟飞机跟随一致
  3. 如果不一致，点击 Status 页面下方飞机显示框右上角的 Edit 按钮
  4. 选择正确的飞控板朝向
  5. 保存并重启，直至朝向正确为止

docs.title: 校准 IMU
docs.text:
首飞前必须校准加速度计：

  1. 将飞机放在水平面上
  2. 点击飞机显示框右上角的 校准 按钮
  3. 等待校准完成
  4. 重启飞控

注意

校准期间请勿移动飞机！

docs.title: 配置电机
docs.text:
安全警告

配置电机前请务必卸下螺旋桨！需要在电调上电的情况下进行。

在电机（Motor）页面进行以下设置：

  1. 配置电机极对数：根据你的电机规格设置
  2. 配置螺旋桨转向：设置正确的旋转方向
  3. 检查电机顺序和朝向：
    • 在 Motor Map 上确认电机位置和转向与预期相符
    • 如果不相符，可以直接在 Motor Map 上编辑
    • 点击对应位置的电机可以修改其转向
    • 通过旁边的箭头可以更改电机位置
    • 调整直至与预期完全相符

docs.title: 配置接收机
docs.text:
在接收机上电的情况下：

  1. 进入 Stick Preview 页面查看摇杆状态
  2. 移动遥控器摇杆，确认显示与实际操作一致
  3. 如果不一致，点击右上角的 Edit 按钮进行修改：
    • 映射通道：调整通道对应关系
    • 极性：修正方向反向的问题
    • 死区：调整摇杆死区大小
  4. AuxFunction 部分可以为指定通道绑定功能：
    • 解锁（Arm）
    • 预解锁（Pre-arm）
    • 自稳模式（Angle Mode）
    • 其他功能...

docs.title: 首飞检查清单
docs.text:
飞行前请确认：

  • 飞控朝向正确
  • IMU 已校准
  • 电机方向和顺序正确
  • 螺旋桨安装正确（注意正反桨）
  • 遥控器通道映射正确
  • 解锁开关已配置
  • 电池电压正常
  • Failsafe 测试通过

docs.title: 下一步
docs.text:
• 配置 PID 参数 - 优化飞行手感
  • 了解 Failsafe - 确保飞行安全

关于滤波器

Fidelity X 固件采用硬编码滤波器设计，用户无需也不应当自行调整滤波器参数。

docs.title: 常见问题
docs.text:
无法进入 DFU 模式
  • 确保按住 BOOT 按钮后再连接 USB
  • 检查 USB 线是否为数据线（非纯充电线）
  • 确认已安装雅特力 DFU 驱动
  • 尝试其他 USB 端口
Configurator 无法连接
  • 确认使用的是 Chrome 或基于 Chromium 的浏览器
  • 检查浏览器是否支持 WebUSB/WebSerial
  • 尝试重新连接 USB
电机不转
  • 确认已成功解锁（Arm）
  • 检查电机极对数设置是否正确
  • 检查电调连接和供电

docs.title: 支持的硬件
docs.text: Fidelity X 支持多款基于 AT32F43x 的飞控板。

docs.title: 官方支持的飞控板
docs.text: 以下飞控板经过完整测试，提供官方支持：

docs.text: 项目 规格 MCU AT32F435CGU7 封装 QFN48 陀螺仪 BMI270 尺寸 20 x 20mm 固件 fydelix-NeutronRCF435MINI

docs.title: Hummingbird 200RS
docs.text: 项目 规格 MCU AT32F435 陀螺仪 BMI270 / ICM-42688-P 尺寸 20 x 20mm 固件 fydelix-Hummingbird200RS

示例：fydelix-NeutronRCF435MINI-0.1.3-8ab496d.hex

docs.title: Legacy 版本
docs.text:
部分飞控有 _legacy 后缀的固件，用于兼容旧版硬件。

如何选择

  • 先尝试普通版本
  • 如果遇到问题，再试 legacy 版本

docs.title: NeutronRC
docs.text:
• 官方：NeutronRC
  • 淘宝：搜索 "NeutronRC F435"

docs.title: 添加新飞控支持
docs.text: 如果你是飞控厂商，希望 Fidelity X 支持你的飞控板，请通过 GitHub 联系我们。

docs.title: 配置指南
docs.text:
页面未完成

本页面内容尚未完成，仅供参考。

本章节介绍如何配置 Fidelity X 固件。

docs.title: 参数系统
docs.text: Fidelity X 使用参数系统进行配置。所有配置都通过 CLI 命令完成。

docs.title: 基本操作
docs.text:
命令 功能 param list 列出所有参数 param get <名称> 获取参数值 param set <名称> <值> 设置参数 param save 保存到 Flash param load 从 Flash 加载 param reset 重置为默认值

保存参数

修改参数后必须执行 param save 才能永久保存！

docs.title: 配置分类
docs.text:
• PID 调参

    调整飞行响应和手感

    前往

  • 速率曲线

    调整操控灵敏度

    前往

  • 安全系统

    配置 Failsafe 保护

    前往

docs.title: 5 寸自由式
docs.text:
param set PID_ROLL_P 45
param set PID_ROLL_I 80
param set PID_ROLL_D 35
param set GYRO_LPF_CUTOFF 100
param save

docs.title: Tiny Whoop
docs.text:
param set PID_ROLL_P 35
param set PID_ROLL_D 25
param set GYRO_LPF_CUTOFF 80
param save

docs.title: 恢复默认设置
docs.text:
param reset
param save

警告

这将清除所有自定义配置！

docs.title: 安全系统 (Failsafe)
docs.text:
页面未完成

本页面内容尚未完成，仅供参考。

Fidelity X 内置完善的安全保护机制，确保飞行安全。

强制启用

安全系统强制启用，无法关闭。

docs.title: 保护功能
docs.text: 功能 说明 RC 信号丢失保护 检测遥控信号丢失并执行保护动作 电池电压监控 实时监控并在 OSD 显示警告 解锁条件检测 检查条件后才允许解锁

docs.title: 二阶段保护策略
docs.text: 阶段 触发条件 默认动作 阶段 1 检测到信号丢失 稳定飞行姿态 阶段 2 阶段 1 超时 安全停机

docs.title: 阶段 1
docs.text:
信号丢失后，飞控会：

  • 将 Roll/Pitch/Yaw 设为中位
  • 保持一定油门
  • 维持稳定飞行姿态

目的：给 RC 信号恢复的机会

docs.title: 阶段 2
docs.text:
如果阶段 1 超时，飞控会：

  • 停止所有电机
  • 防止失控造成更大损害

docs.title: RC 丢失参数
docs.text: 参数 默认值 说明 FS_RC_LOSS_STAGE_1_TIME 150 阶段 1 持续时间 (ms) FS_RC_STAGE1_ACTION 1 阶段 1 动作 FS_RC_STAGE2_ACTION 3 阶段 2 动作 FS_LAND_THROTTLE 0.3 RC 丢失时油门值

docs.title: 动作类型
docs.text: 代码 动作 0 无动作 1 通道覆盖（稳定飞行） 2 自动降落 3 停机

docs.title: 电池参数
docs.text:
参数 默认值 说明 FS_BAT_WARN_V 14.4 警告电压 (V) FS_BAT_CRIT_V 13.2 危险电压 (V)

说明

电池监控仅在 OSD 显示警告，不会触发停机。

docs.title: 解锁条件
docs.text:
解锁前系统会检查：

  • 传感器状态正常
  • 油门在最低位
  • RC 信号有效
  • 加速度计已校准

所有条件满足后才能解锁。

docs.title: 查看状态
docs.text:
failsafe status

显示当前安全系统状态。

docs.title: 测试
docs.text:
警告

测试前请卸下螺旋桨！

# 测试 RC 丢失响应
failsafe test rc

# 测试解锁条件
failsafe test arming

# 重置状态
failsafe reset

docs.title: 竞速配置
docs.text:
更快的响应：

param set FS_RC_LOSS_STAGE_1_TIME 100
param save

docs.title: 长航时配置
docs.text:
给信号恢复更多时间：

param set FS_RC_LOSS_STAGE_1_TIME 500
param save

docs.title: 飞行前检查
docs.text:
1. 确认 Failsafe 状态正常
  2. 测试 RC 丢失响应（关闭遥控器）
  3. 验证信号恢复后能重新控制

docs.title: PID 调参
docs.text:
页面未完成

本页面内容尚未完成，仅供参考。

本指南介绍如何调整 PID 参数以获得最佳飞行性能。

docs.title: PID 基础
docs.text:
PID 控制器由三部分组成：

项 作用 P (比例) 响应当前误差，值越大响应越快 I (积分) 消除稳态误差，保持姿态 D (微分) 预测和抑制振荡

docs.title: Roll/Pitch
docs.text: 参数 说明 默认值 PID_ROLL_P Roll P增益 45 PID_ROLL_I Roll I增益 80 PID_ROLL_D Roll D增益 35 PID_PITCH_P Pitch P增益 45 PID_PITCH_I Pitch I增益 80 PID_PITCH_D Pitch D增益 35

docs.title: Yaw
docs.text: 参数 说明 默认值 PID_YAW_P Yaw P增益 45 PID_YAW_I Yaw I增益 80 PID_YAW_D Yaw D增益 0

docs.title: 步骤 1：调整 P
docs.text:
1. 从默认值开始
  2. 逐渐增加 P
  3. 出现高频振动时，降低 10-20%

docs.title: 步骤 2：调整 D
docs.text:
1. D 用于抑制 P 引起的振荡
  2. 逐渐增加 D
  3. 电机发热或出现噪声时，降低 D

D 项过高的症状

  • 电机发热
  • 高频噪声
  • 螺旋桨颤抖

docs.title: 步骤 3：调整 I
docs.text:
1. I 用于保持姿态
  2. 通常使用默认值即可
  3. I 过低会导致漂移，过高会导致低频摆动

docs.title: 高频振动
docs.text:
症状：悬停时螺旋桨模糊、电机发热

解决：降低 D 增益或滤波器截止频率

docs.title: 低频摆动
docs.text:
症状：飞机左右摇摆

解决：降低 P 或 I 增益

docs.title: 响应迟钝
docs.text:
症状：打杆后响应延迟

解决：增加 P 和 D 增益

docs.title: 5 寸自由式
docs.text: 参数 值 P (Roll/Pitch) 45 I (Roll/Pitch) 80 D (Roll/Pitch) 35

docs.title: 5 寸竞速
docs.text: 参数 值 P (Roll/Pitch) 55 I (Roll/Pitch) 90 D (Roll/Pitch) 40

docs.title: Tiny Whoop
docs.text: 参数 值 P (Roll/Pitch) 35 I (Roll/Pitch) 70 D (Roll/Pitch) 25

docs.title: 调参检查清单
docs.text:
• 校准加速度计
  • 检查电机方向
  • 从默认 PID 开始
  • 先调 P，再调 D
  • 最后微调 I
  • 保存设置
param save

docs.title: 速率曲线
docs.text:
页面未完成

本页面内容尚未完成，仅供参考。

速率曲线定义了摇杆位置与飞机旋转速度之间的关系。

docs.title: 速率曲线类型
docs.text:
Fidelity X 支持多种速率曲线：

类型 特点 Betaflight Rate 与 Betaflight 兼容，便于迁移 Actual Rate 更直观，直接设置最大角速度

docs.title: 参数
docs.text: 参数 说明 范围 RC Rate 基础速率 0.1 - 3.0 Super Rate 摇杆末端增益 0.0 - 1.0 Expo 中心区域曲线 0.0 - 1.0

docs.title: 参数作用
docs.text:
• RC Rate：影响整体响应，尤其是中心区域
  • Super Rate：影响摇杆末端的最大速度
  • Expo：降低中心区域灵敏度

docs.title: 参数
docs.text: 参数 说明 范围 Center Sensitivity 中心灵敏度 (°/s) 50 - 500 Max Rate 最大角速度 (°/s) 200 - 2000 Expo 曲线指数 0.0 - 1.0

docs.title: 优点
docs.text:
• 更直观易懂
  • 直接设置最大角速度
  • 独立调整中心灵敏度

docs.title: 入门
docs.text: 参数 Roll Pitch Yaw RC Rate 0.7 0.7 0.7 Super Rate 0.5 0.5 0.5 Expo 0.3 0.3 0.0

docs.title: 中级
docs.text: 参数 Roll Pitch Yaw RC Rate 1.0 1.0 1.0 Super Rate 0.7 0.7 0.7 Expo 0.2 0.2 0.0

docs.title: 高级
docs.text: 参数 Roll Pitch Yaw RC Rate 1.2 1.2 1.0 Super Rate 0.8 0.8 0.7 Expo 0.1 0.1 0.0

docs.title: 中心太敏感
docs.text:
增加 Expo： 

param set ROLL_RC_EXPO 0.3
param set PITCH_RC_EXPO 0.3
param save

docs.title: 翻滚速度不够
docs.text:
增加 Super Rate： 

param set ROLL_SUPER_RATE 0.8
param save

docs.title: Yaw 抖动
docs.text:
降低 Yaw 速率： 

param set YAW_RC_RATE 0.8
param save

docs.title: 从 Betaflight 迁移
docs.text:
如果你从 Betaflight 迁移，可以直接使用相同的速率设置：

  1. 选择 Betaflight Rate 类型
  2. 输入你在 Betaflight 中的 RC Rate、Super Rate、Expo 值
  3. 保存设置

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: atbetaflight adds AT32 chip support to Betaflight, suitable for users familiar with Betaflight for seamless migration.

docs.text:
Based on Betaflight 4.3.1, with the following additions:

docs.text: This tutorial explains how to use atbetaflight firmware.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
You need to install:

  • Artery DFU Driver
  • Betaflight Configurator (specific version)

Download Artery DFU Driver Download Betaflight Configurator

docs.title: Download Firmware
docs.text: Download the latest firmware from GitHub Releases.

docs.title: Firmware Selection Guide
docs.text:
Choose firmware based on your flight controller:

MCU FC Firmware AT32F435VMT7 EMSRPROTO2 / Chongshan 1.2 betaflight-xxx-EMSRPROTO2 AT32F437VGT7 EMSRPROTO3 betaflight-xxx-EMSRPROTO3 AT32F435RGT7 NEUTRONRCF435SE betaflight-xxx-NEUTRONRCF435SE AT32F435CGU7 NEUTRONRCF435MINI betaflight-xxx-NEUTRONRCF435MINI

docs.title: Flash Firmware
docs.text:
1. Hold FC BOOT button and connect USB
  2. Open Betaflight Configurator
  3. Click Firmware Flasher
  4. Click Load local firmware and select firmware
  5. Flash like a normal F4 flight controller

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
Important

  • DIY boards with blank MCU need to flash User System Data first (only once) using Artery tools
  • Pre-built flight controllers don't need this step
  • Do not check "No reboot sequence" option if FC is not in DFU mode

It's a new answer to the question: "What should flight feel like?"—not optimization, but built from scratch. Every line of code serves a single purpose: to create an unprecedented intimate connection between you and your aircraft.

docs.title: Performance by Architecture
docs.text:
• Instant Response

    Parallel architecture, independent tasks—from fingertip to propeller, microsecond delivery, seamlessly

  • Built from Scratch

    Every line of code, born for flight—no porting, no compromise, only purity

  • Progressive Protection

    Multi-stage safety mechanisms, from signal recovery to safe landing, every stage has a plan

  • Precision Filtering

    Carefully tuned signal processing chain, where sharp response and silky feel are no longer a trade-off

docs.title: Experience from Details
docs.text:
• Physics Modeling

    Based on rigid body dynamics, every response of the aircraft behaves exactly as it should

  • One-Click Calibration

    Sensor self-calibration, just rest for a moment—let the firmware handle the complex tasks

  • Intuitive Configuration

    Clean interface, clear logic—understand at a glance, master immediately

  • Lossless Recording

    Newly developed lossless blackbox logging, your every action precisely recorded and fully restored

  • Betaflight Rate — The feel you know, seamless migration
  • Actual Rate — Intuitive setup, what you set is what you get
  • FlightOne Rate — Natural choice for FalcoX pilots

Yaw, Pitch, and Roll can each use different curves. Your flight style, defined by you.

docs.title: Features
docs.text: Every feature, refined to perfection. Every detail, in service of better flight.

docs.title: Real-Time Architecture
docs.text:
Not optimization. Redesign.

Traditional firmware processes tasks sequentially in a single loop—any delay cascades through the system. Fidelity X employs a real-time operating system where critical tasks truly run in parallel:

  • Gyro sampling independent of main loop
  • Attitude computation with dedicated priority
  • Motor output always on time

The result: deterministic response time, regardless of system load.

docs.title: Filtering System
docs.text: Signal processing defines flight quality.

docs.title: Gyro Filtering
docs.text:
Consumer MEMS gyroscopes aren't perfect—motor vibration, frame resonance, sensor noise all contaminate raw data.

Our filtering system precisely identifies these disturbances while preserving genuine attitude changes. What you feel is the precise response from clean flight data.

docs.title: D-Term Filtering
docs.text:
The PID derivative is inherently noise-sensitive. We designed a dedicated low phase-shift filter that suppresses high-frequency noise while minimizing phase distortion.

The effect: motors stay cool, response stays sharp.

docs.title: Safety System
docs.text:
Always running. Cannot be disabled.

This isn't an optional feature—it's our design philosophy.

docs.title: Signal Loss Protection
docs.text:
Two-stage intelligent response:

Stage Trigger Response Stage 1 Signal lost Attitude stabilization Stage 2 Sustained loss Controlled disarm

docs.title: Arming Checks
docs.text:
Before takeoff, the system automatically verifies:

  • Sensors functioning normally
  • Throttle at minimum
  • RC signal valid
  • System health confirmed

Only when everything checks out is arming permitted.

docs.title: Dual-Loop PID
docs.text:
• Outer loop: Angle control for self-level mode
  • Inner loop: Angular rate control, the source of responsiveness

docs.title: Rate Curves
docs.text:
Three styles. One choice—yours.

Curve Best For Betaflight Rate Pilots migrating from Betaflight Actual Rate Pilots who prefer intuitive setup FlightOne Rate Pilots migrating from FalcoX

Each axis can use a different curve type. Mix and match as you like.

docs.title: OSD
docs.text:
MSP protocol driven, compatible with popular VTX. What appears on screen is what you need:

Battery voltage　 Flight time　 Signal strength　 Flight mode

docs.title: Blackbox
docs.text:
Flight data, fully preserved.

Using a time-series compression format based on the Gorilla algorithm, more flight time is recorded in limited Flash space. Every frame saved losslessly, ready for deep post-flight analysis.

docs.title: RC Protocols
docs.text: Protocol Rate Notes CRSF 150-500Hz Recommended, lowest latency SBUS 100Hz Widely compatible

docs.title: Motor Protocol
docs.text:
Bidirectional DShot600.

Command transmission and RPM feedback both complete in microseconds. Closed-loop design enables dynamic RPM filtering—precisely tracking motor harmonics, eliminating them in real time.

docs.title: Firmware Flashing
docs.text:
Page Incomplete

This page is not yet complete and is for reference only.

This guide explains how to flash Fidelity X firmware to your flight controller.

docs.title: Flashing Methods
docs.text: Method Use Case Difficulty USB DFU Regular updates ⭐ Easy Artery ISP First flash/Recovery ⭐⭐ Medium SWD Development ⭐⭐⭐ Advanced

docs.title: USB DFU Mode (Recommended)
docs.text: This is the most common firmware flashing method.

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Download Artery DFU Driver
  2. Download Artery ISP Programmer
  3. Download firmware for your board

docs.title: 1. Enter DFU Mode
docs.text:
1. Disconnect all power from flight controller
  2. Press and hold BOOT button
  3. Connect USB cable to computer
  4. Release BOOT button

docs.title: 2. Verify DFU Mode
docs.text:
In Windows Device Manager, you should see:

Universal Serial Bus controllers
└── AT32 DFU Device

Driver Issues

If shown as "Unknown device", install the Artery DFU driver.

docs.title: 3. Flash Firmware
docs.text:
1. Open Artery ISP Programmer
  2. Select USB interface
  3. Click Connect
  4. Load .hex firmware in Download tab
  5. Click Download to start flashing
  6. Wait for completion

docs.title: 4. Complete
docs.text: Disconnect USB, reconnect, and the flight controller will run the new firmware.

docs.title: Using CLI to Enter DFU
docs.text:
If the flight controller is already running Fidelity X, you can enter DFU mode via command:

bootloader

The flight controller will reboot and automatically enter DFU mode.

docs.title: First Flash on Blank Chip
docs.text:
Important

Brand new blank chips require User System Data (USD) to be written first. Pre-built flight controllers usually have this pre-written and don't need this step.

  1. In Artery ISP Programmer, select "User System Data"
  2. Load the USD file for your chip
  3. Click Download
  4. Then flash the firmware

docs.title: SWD Debugger Flashing
docs.text: For development, requires SWD debugger (e.g., J-Link, DAP-Link).

docs.title: Wiring
docs.text: Debugger FC SWDIO SWDIO SWCLK SWCLK GND GND

docs.title: Firmware Selection Reference
docs.text: Board Firmware Name NeutronRC F435 SE fydelix-NeutronRCF435SE NeutronRC F435 MINI fydelix-NeutronRCF435MINI Hummingbird 200RS fydelix-Hummingbird200RS Hummingbird 255 V1 fydelix-Hummingbird255V1REVA StingerBee fydelix-StingerBee

docs.title: Connect Serial
docs.text:
• Baud rate: 115200
  • Data bits: 8
  • Stop bits: 1

docs.title: Check Boot
docs.text:
After normal boot, you'll see the command prompt: msh />

Enter status to view system status.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Cannot enter DFU mode
  • Ensure USB cable is a data cable
  • Try different USB port
  • Hold BOOT button before connecting USB
Flash failed
  • Check if firmware matches your board
  • Try full chip erase then reflash
  • Check USB connection stability
Cannot boot after flash
  • Confirm correct firmware model
  • Try _legacy version firmware
  • Check serial port baud rate settings

docs.title: Factory Reset
docs.text:
param reset
param save

Warning

This will erase all custom settings!

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with Fidelity X firmware quickly.

docs.title: Hardware Requirements
docs.text:
• Supported flight controller (view list)
  • USB data cable
  • Computer (Windows/macOS/Linux)

docs.title: Software Requirements
docs.text:
Software Purpose Source Artery DFU Driver Firmware flashing Artery Website Chrome/Chromium Browser Configurator access Must support WebUSB/WebSerial

Browser Requirements

A browser with WebUSB/WebSerial support is required. Chrome or Chromium-based browsers (such as Edge, Brave, etc.) are recommended.

docs.title: 1. Download Firmware
docs.text:
Download the firmware for your flight controller from GitHub Releases.

Firmware naming format: fydelix-<board>-<version>-<commit>.hex

Tip

Not sure which firmware? Check Supported Hardware to find your board.

docs.title: 2. Flash Firmware
docs.text:
See Firmware Flashing Guide for detailed steps.

Quick steps:

  1. Press and hold the BOOT button
  2. Connect USB cable to computer
  3. Release BOOT button
  4. Select the local firmware file in Configurator
  5. Click the flash button

docs.title: 3. First Connection
docs.text:
After flashing, connect to the flight controller using Configurator:

  1. Click the Connect button in the top right corner
  2. Select FlightNG FC from the popup menu

docs.title: Check Flight Controller Orientation
docs.text:
First, verify that the flight controller orientation is correct:

  1. Observe the aircraft attitude displayed in Configurator
  2. Move the actual aircraft and confirm the virtual aircraft follows accordingly
  3. If they don't match, click the Edit button in the top right corner of the aircraft display box on the Status page
  4. Select the correct flight controller orientation
  5. Save and restart until the orientation is correct

docs.title: Calibrate IMU
docs.text:
You must calibrate the accelerometer before first flight:

  1. Place the aircraft on a level surface
  2. Click the Calibrate button in the top right corner of the aircraft display box
  3. Wait for calibration to complete
  4. Restart the flight controller

Warning

Do not move the aircraft during calibration!

docs.title: Configure Motors
docs.text:
Safety Warning

Remove propellers before configuring motors! ESC must be powered on.

On the Motor page, configure the following:

  1. Configure motor pole pairs: Set according to your motor specifications
  2. Configure propeller rotation direction: Set the correct rotation direction
  3. Check motor order and direction:
    • Verify motor positions and directions match expectations on the Motor Map
    • If they don't match, you can edit directly on the Motor Map
    • Click on a motor position to change its rotation direction
    • Use the arrows to change motor position
    • Adjust until everything matches expectations

docs.title: Configure Receiver
docs.text:
With the receiver powered on:

  1. Go to the Stick Preview page to view stick status
  2. Move the transmitter sticks and confirm the display matches your actual inputs
  3. If they don't match, click the Edit button in the top right corner to modify:
    • Channel mapping: Adjust channel assignments
    • Polarity: Fix reversed directions
    • Deadband: Adjust stick deadband size
  4. The AuxFunction section allows you to bind functions to specific channels:
    • Arm
    • Pre-arm
    • Angle Mode
    • Other functions...

docs.title: Pre-Flight Checklist
docs.text:
Before flying, confirm:

  • Flight controller orientation correct
  • IMU calibrated
  • Motor direction and order correct
  • Propellers installed correctly (check CW/CCW)
  • Receiver channel mapping correct
  • Arm switch configured
  • Battery voltage normal
  • Failsafe test passed

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Configure PID - Optimize flight feel
  • Learn about Failsafe - Ensure flight safety

About Filters

Fidelity X firmware uses hardcoded filters by design. Users should not adjust filter parameters.

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Cannot enter DFU mode
  • Make sure to hold BOOT button before connecting USB
  • Check if USB cable is a data cable (not charge-only)
  • Confirm Artery DFU driver is installed
  • Try different USB port
Configurator cannot connect
  • Confirm you are using Chrome or a Chromium-based browser
  • Check if browser supports WebUSB/WebSerial
  • Try reconnecting USB
Motors not spinning
  • Confirm successful arm
  • Check motor pole pair settings
  • Check ESC connection and power

Save Parameters

docs.text:
• PID Tuning

    Adjust flight response and feel

    Go

  • Rate Profiles

docs.text:
param set PID_ROLL_P 45
param set PID_ROLL_I 80

docs.title: Safety System (Failsafe)
docs.text:
Page Incomplete

This page is not yet complete and is for reference only.

Fidelity X has built-in comprehensive safety protection to ensure flight safety.

Always Enabled

The safety system is always enabled and cannot be disabled.

docs.title: Protection Features
docs.text: Feature Description RC Loss Protection Detects RC signal loss and executes protection action Battery Voltage Monitoring Real-time monitoring with OSD warning display Arming Condition Detection Checks conditions before allowing arm

docs.title: Two-Stage Protection Strategy
docs.text: Stage Trigger Default Action Stage 1 Signal loss detected Stabilize flight attitude Stage 2 Stage 1 timeout Safe disarm

docs.title: Stage 1
docs.text:
After signal loss, the flight controller will:

  • Set Roll/Pitch/Yaw to center
  • Maintain some throttle
  • Stabilize flight attitude

Purpose: Give RC signal a chance to recover

docs.title: Stage 2
docs.text:
If Stage 1 times out, the flight controller will:

  • Stop all motors
  • Prevent further damage from loss of control

docs.title: RC Loss Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Default Description FS_RC_LOSS_STAGE_1_TIME 150 Stage 1 duration (ms) FS_RC_STAGE1_ACTION 1 Stage 1 action FS_RC_STAGE2_ACTION 3 Stage 2 action FS_LAND_THROTTLE 0.3 Throttle value during RC loss

docs.title: Action Types
docs.text: Code Action 0 None 1 Channel override (stabilize) 2 Auto land 3 Disarm

docs.title: Battery Parameters
docs.text:
Parameter Default Description FS_BAT_WARN_V 14.4 Warning voltage (V) FS_BAT_CRIT_V 13.2 Critical voltage (V)

Note

Battery monitoring only shows OSD warnings, it does not trigger disarm.

docs.title: Arming Conditions
docs.text:
Before arming, the system checks:

  • Sensor status normal
  • Throttle at lowest position
  • RC signal valid
  • Accelerometer calibrated

All conditions must be met before arming is allowed.

docs.title: Check Status
docs.text:
failsafe status

Shows current safety system status.

docs.title: Testing
docs.text:
Warning

Remove propellers before testing!

# Test RC loss response
failsafe test rc

# Test arming conditions
failsafe test arming

# Reset state
failsafe reset

docs.title: Racing Configuration
docs.text:
Faster response:

param set FS_RC_LOSS_STAGE_1_TIME 100
param save

docs.title: Long Range Configuration
docs.text:
More time for signal recovery:

param set FS_RC_LOSS_STAGE_1_TIME 500
param save

docs.title: Pre-Flight Check
docs.text:
1. Confirm Failsafe status is normal
  2. Test RC loss response (turn off transmitter)
  3. Verify control recovers after signal returns

docs.title: PID Tuning
docs.text:
Page Incomplete

This page is not yet complete and is for reference only.

This guide explains how to tune PID parameters for optimal flight performance.

docs.title: PID Basics
docs.text:
A PID controller consists of three parts:

Term Function P (Proportional) Responds to current error, higher = faster response I (Integral) Eliminates steady-state error, maintains attitude D (Derivative) Predicts and dampens oscillation

docs.title: Roll/Pitch
docs.text: Parameter Description Default PID_ROLL_P Roll P gain 45 PID_ROLL_I Roll I gain 80 PID_ROLL_D Roll D gain 35 PID_PITCH_P Pitch P gain 45 PID_PITCH_I Pitch I gain 80 PID_PITCH_D Pitch D gain 35

docs.title: Yaw
docs.text: Parameter Description Default PID_YAW_P Yaw P gain 45 PID_YAW_I Yaw I gain 80 PID_YAW_D Yaw D gain 0

docs.title: Step 1: Tune P
docs.text:
1. Start from defaults
  2. Gradually increase P
  3. When high-frequency oscillation appears, reduce by 10-20%

docs.title: Step 2: Tune D
docs.text:
1. D is used to dampen P-induced oscillation
  2. Gradually increase D
  3. If motors heat up or noise appears, reduce D

Symptoms of Too High D

  • Motor heating
  • High-frequency noise
  • Propeller flutter

docs.title: Step 3: Tune I
docs.text:
1. I is used to maintain attitude
  2. Default value usually works
  3. Too low causes drift, too high causes low-frequency wobble

docs.title: High-Frequency Vibration
docs.text:
Symptoms: Propellers blurry at hover, motors heating

Solution: Reduce D gain or filter cutoff frequency

docs.title: Low-Frequency Wobble
docs.text:
Symptoms: Aircraft swaying side to side

Solution: Reduce P or I gain

docs.title: Sluggish Response
docs.text:
Symptoms: Delayed response after stick input

Solution: Increase P and D gain

docs.title: 5-inch Freestyle
docs.text: Parameter Value P (Roll/Pitch) 45 I (Roll/Pitch) 80 D (Roll/Pitch) 35

docs.title: 5-inch Racing
docs.text: Parameter Value P (Roll/Pitch) 55 I (Roll/Pitch) 90 D (Roll/Pitch) 40

docs.title: Tiny Whoop
docs.text: Parameter Value P (Roll/Pitch) 35 I (Roll/Pitch) 70 D (Roll/Pitch) 25

docs.title: Tuning Checklist
docs.text:
• Calibrate accelerometer
  • Check motor direction
  • Start from default PID
  • Tune P first, then D
  • Fine-tune I last
  • Save settings
param save

docs.title: Rate Profiles
docs.text:
Page Incomplete

This page is not yet complete and is for reference only.

Rate profiles define the relationship between stick position and aircraft rotation speed.

docs.title: Rate Profile Types
docs.text:
Fidelity X supports multiple rate profiles:

Type Characteristics Betaflight Rate Compatible with Betaflight, easy migration Actual Rate More intuitive, directly set max angular velocity

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description Range RC Rate Base rate 0.1 - 3.0 Super Rate Stick-end gain 0.0 - 1.0 Expo Center area curve 0.0 - 1.0

docs.title: Parameter Effects
docs.text:
• RC Rate: Affects overall response, especially center area
  • Super Rate: Affects max speed at stick ends
  • Expo: Reduces center area sensitivity

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Description Range Center Sensitivity Center sensitivity (°/s) 50 - 500 Max Rate Max angular velocity (°/s) 200 - 2000 Expo Curve exponent 0.0 - 1.0

docs.title: Advantages
docs.text:
• More intuitive
  • Directly set max angular velocity
  • Independently adjust center sensitivity

docs.title: Beginner
docs.text: Parameter Roll Pitch Yaw RC Rate 0.7 0.7 0.7 Super Rate 0.5 0.5 0.5 Expo 0.3 0.3 0.0

docs.title: Intermediate
docs.text: Parameter Roll Pitch Yaw RC Rate 1.0 1.0 1.0 Super Rate 0.7 0.7 0.7 Expo 0.2 0.2 0.0

docs.title: Advanced
docs.text: Parameter Roll Pitch Yaw RC Rate 1.2 1.2 1.0 Super Rate 0.8 0.8 0.7 Expo 0.1 0.1 0.0

docs.title: Center too sensitive
docs.text:
Increase Expo: 

param set ROLL_RC_EXPO 0.3
param set PITCH_RC_EXPO 0.3
param save

docs.title: Roll speed too slow
docs.text:
Increase Super Rate: 

param set ROLL_SUPER_RATE 0.8
param save

docs.title: Yaw twitchy
docs.text:
Reduce Yaw rate: 

param set YAW_RC_RATE 0.8
param save

docs.title: Migrating from Betaflight
docs.text:
If migrating from Betaflight, you can use the same rate settings:

  1. Select Betaflight Rate type
  2. Enter your Betaflight RC Rate, Super Rate, Expo values
  3. Save settings
